question: 1 (e)
statement_html:
For each of the following multiple-choice questions, there is one correct answer. Circle the corresponding (roman) numeral.

\(\displaystyle 1 -2x^{2}\) is the second order Taylor polynomial (around \(x=0\)) for which one of the following functions?

i. \(\displaystyle 1 -\sin(4x)\)

ii. \(\displaystyle e^{-x^{2}}\)

iii. \(\displaystyle \cos(2x)\)

iv. \(\displaystyle e^{-4x}\)

v. \(\displaystyle \cos(x)\)
statement_latex:

statement_raw:
For each of the following multiple-choice questions, there is one correct answer. Circle the corresponding (roman) numeral.

<math> \displaystyle 1 -2x^{2} </math> is the second order Taylor polynomial (around <math>x=0 </math>) for which one of the following functions?

i. <math> \displaystyle 1 -\sin(4x) </math>

ii. <math> \displaystyle e^{-x^{2}} </math>

iii. <math> \displaystyle \cos(2x) </math>

iv. <math> \displaystyle e^{-4x} </math>

v. <math> \displaystyle \cos(x) </math>
